You roll out of bed at about ten in the morning, do a fairly shoddy job brushing your teeth, and do the few chores your parents set aside for you before becoming one with the couch and zoning out to TV the rest of the day. But something was new today that you hadn't seen before.

On the list, Mom stated to "Clear out the attic space so the vent guys can get up there later this week". This was a change due to the fact that you had forgotten your house even had an attic space. After pulling out the ladder in the empty garage, you, somewhat excitedly, peered into the darkness that was the garage attic... only for it to be rather underwhelming. Two old cardboard boxes. You sighed and pulled both boxes down, one heavy, one light, both unlabeled.

You put the ladder away and breathed in deep, letting the crispy autumn air come through the open garage door. It was tempting to just push the boxes aside and let nature (or your Ma) sort 'em out, but your curiosity got the better of you. You opened the heavy one first. Strange looking oddities. Roman strapped sandals, ornate discuses, and the top of an antique trident. No clue who those belonged to. The second box only had a single vase in it, made out of colorful marbled stone, covered in dust. It was honestly a beautiful piece, even though you weren't any type of an art critic. You pulled the vase out, and rubbed some of the caked dust off of it. Arabic symbols covered the side.

"Ah," A voice whispered in the back of your mind. "You'll do."

You felt a bizarre fuzzy feeling... then you saw it. The vase was belching colorful red smoke. You attempted to put it down but hands wouldn't drop it. The smoke encircled you, engulfing you entirely, until... you were somewhere else.

*****


The room you were in was brightly lit, and covered in beautiful ornate rugs and massive pillows, with a single round bed on the opposite side. It smelled like lilacs and spices, and light poured out of brightly colored windows. Above you, you could see a dark hole where the ceiling should be. You were... confused, to say the least.

"Hello?" You called, as your voice seemed to get eaten by the rugs hanging from the walls. "Where am I? Mom?"

"Hello sweet mud-child," the same voice from your head called, except it was now spread in this room like there was mounted speakers. The voice was soft, being neither male or female, and had a calming presence regardless of the alarming situation. "You are most welcome with my capsule. I have been called and shall be known as Cal, the Spirit of the Capsule. I reside within the vessel. You mud-name is Liam Finn, is it not? I have heard your name reverberate among these walls. "Uh..." You respond, feeling quite small and not knowing which direction to talk. "You... know me? I gotta admit I'm a bit at a disadvantage. You're name is Cal?"

"Yes, child of the mud," Cal responded mysteriously. "I am an old vessel of the many nights. I was created by viziers or old to house spirits... much older than they. Their powers yet reside within this place, the bodies they used to wield, fire, air, water and earth all have lived within, captured by the men of the mud to serve their callings."

"I'm afraid I don't get it, Cal," You respond nervously. "What is this, where am I?"

"Ah, yes, I am forgetful," Cal tutted at itself. "You are within the vessel. It is... the urn you held but a moment ago, known in the tongue of your ancestors as the Urn of Remembrance, though this is not its first or true name. It used to hold the djinn of your plane before they retreated to the baser elements."

"Wait.... djinn..." You took a moment to consider. "Like a genie? With the 3 wishes?"

"No, mud-child, djinn, not a 'gee-knee'," Cal corrected. "And you have heard some variation of the tales or old, of the nights long forgotten and re-remembered incorrectly? Yes, there are wishes. Yes, there are generally three."

"Wait... are you a djinn?" You mutter in amazement. "Do... do I get 3 wishes?"

Cal let out a short, sharp laugh. "Haha, no dear mud-child. I am but a created spirit for the housing. Neither ifrit or dao, I cannot conjure the wishes you desire. This is why I have brought you."

You blinked. "I don't understand."

"You shall quickly," Cal said politely.

All at once a short gust of air knocked you off your feet and began to levitate you about a foot off the ground. The rugs and curtains shook with unearthly wind. It was not loud, but it could be felt.

"You are to receive power overwhelming, as I bestow on you the aspect of a spirit who came before, a djinn of immense power over reality named Zham. It will not be a painless process. You now understood your body and its wants and desires. You felt ready to go again almost a minute later, but you pulled your teenage mind back, and replaced your clothes. You figured you main focus should be to get out of here, and bring this power with you so you could decide what to do with your new power.

Your magic, this wish granting power, must have a way to give you your power.

"Hmmm..." You muttered, replacing your pants somewhat shamefully. "I... I should make a wish. Uh... I wish that I was out of this urn."

You then snapped your fingers, and a magical spark appeared... but fizzled just as quickly.

"Okay, so I can't grant my own wishes..." You mused. "That... sucks. Maybe I can convince someone to wish for me..."
14.title: The New You

info.brief_description: Life with a genie would be divine, every wish granted. Life AS a genie however....
info.description:
Life has been difficult recently for you and your family, but a boon from nowhere has fallen into your lap, given you a way you may fix your problems, but with a catch... you are shifted into a beautiful, immortal djinn of elemental earth, and forced to grant the wishes of others. Will you help those who pick up your lamp, or use their wishes against them? Will you attempt return to your family, or attempt to take your new power with you outside of the lamp and control the world around you at a whim? Your fate is yours to decide...


Rules for Posting:

1. No child abuse of any kind (all players of the story are over the age of consent)
2. No gratuitous violence
3. Use good grammar, syntax, and punctuation to the best of your ability. Chapters should be over 500 characters long and add something to the tale. If the tale is too disconnected from its previous chapters or is unreadable, it will be deleted.

Players:

Liam Finn (YOU): (18/M) You are Liam, a skeptic recent high school graduate with zero prospects. You are a bit soft around the middle, a medium height, and not particularly talented in any field, though you have always been a fan of a good puzzle. You don't have the money to attend a nice school, and you don't have the want to work a dead end job. But you know your family is struggling and wish you could help lift everyone up.

Bartholomew(Bart) Mable: (42/M) Your step-father, a single dad who married your Mom four years ago in a small ceremony. He's got a shaved head with a short goatee, wears thick-framed glasses, and is in pretty good shape, though not as good as when you met him. Bart is trying to do the best for his family, but works a stressful job as a underpaid IT manager, and sometimes takes his frustrations home with him.

Mel Finn:(38/F) Your mother, currently unemployed after her job became obsolete due to new technology, she is doing her best to be a homemaker but it is not her forte. She has bright red hair, light smile lines at her eyes, and though she is a bit on the shorter side, being only 5'4'', she works out while you are at school after job searching and is fit. However, you can tell that she somewhat resents her situation after losing her husband a decade ago, and really is done being a parent.

Corey Mable: (21/M) Your step-sister, a college sorority sister who joined your family recently. She has glossy blonde hair, a tribal sleeve tattoo, and is tall and curvaceous. She is organized and gorgeous, but her personality makes it difficult for her to make friends or connections, she hasn't brought an SO home, either men or women, who have ever returned. She doesn't treat you or the family with much respect, but does at these give you your privacy when needed.

Mila Finn: (18/F) Your biological twin, you are fraternal twins as she looks pretty different, but you were born together and everything. Mila is fun-loving but kind of ditsy, and takes a lot after her Mom in terms of looks, and unfortunately, height. She wears short-cropped, dark red hair and has a face full of freckles. Unlike you, however, she has legitimate plans for the future, going into forensic biology at Yale starting early next year.

Riley Nept:(18/M) Your best friend from school, always encouraging you to follow your dreams or get into mischief. He is a little shorter than you, but his curly, dirt blond locks make him a bit taller. He has a bit of a reputation among your family of flirtation, but has never been particularly successful. He has plans on going into veterinary school and taking care of critters.

Sarah Pardasha: (19/F) Your neighbor, and a year your senior, Sarah has already begun making her mark on the neighborhood, going straight into reality after graduating high school, and loving to volunteer. She is tall, dark skinned, without too many curves but a very positive attitude. Occasionally, she comes by to take you on walks to keep your spirits up. She is currently married to an older man whom you have never met, but it doesn't seem like she is enjoying the relationship any longer.

Cal, Spirit of the Capsule: (40,000/?) Cal, the spirit of the capsule talks in a voice unidentifiable as male or female, and is bound to the brightly colored Urn of Remembrance. Cal believes that they are the expert in humanity's desires, and simply wishes for others to carry on the tradition of the long forgotten djinn, who have long since moved on from this world.

Sandra Finn:: (33/F) You mother's younger sister, a failed entrepreneur who was roped into three terrible multi-level-marketing schemes one after the other. She has declared bankruptcy and is slowly recovering from financial ruin. Olive skin with brunette hair, she stands at around 6 feet tall, much taller than your Mom, and cleared they don't share the same father.


Enjoy!
